2024 年 1 月 8 日星期一 15:59:59 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
替代肉类是打造更健康星球的良方吗？ |张涛张涛A Chinese saying goes, "There's no pleasure in eating without meat." And the data backs that up: every year, China consumes 26 percent of the world's meat and 45 percent of its seafood — numbers that could grow alongside rising incomes. Impact investor Tao Zhang shows why getting Chinese consumers to switch to plant-based alternatives is vital to tackling climate change and explores how it's also a massive business opportunity to bring tasty, affordable new proteins to market.替代肉类是打造更健康星球的良方吗？ |张涛A Chinese saying goes, "There's no pleasure in eating without meat." And the data backs that up: every year, China consumes 26 percent of the world's meat and 45 percent of its seafood — numbers that could grow alongside rising incomes. Impact investor Tao Zhang shows why getting Chinese consumers to switch to plant-based alternatives is vital to tackling climate change and explores how it's also a massive business opportunity to bring tasty, affordable new proteins to market. https://www.ted.com/talks/tao_zhang_is_alternative_meat_the_recipe_for_a_healthier_planet?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118892 118892 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 15:53:49 +0000高等教育不00:10:48泰德
繁文缛节已经够多了——我们需要对清洁能源说“是”|里奇·鲍威尔里奇·鲍威尔Climate innovation leader Rich Powell dives into the bureaucracy, bottlenecks and not-in-my-backyard attitude preventing the US from achieving its green energy goals, warning that we need about 10,000 new clean energy projects to be built in the US this decade if we're to reach net zero by 2050. Learn more about what's needed to fight NIMBYism, get serious about the energy transition — and get out of our own way.繁文缛节已经够多了——我们需要对清洁能源说“是”|里奇·鲍威尔Climate innovation leader Rich Powell dives into the bureaucracy, bottlenecks and not-in-my-backyard attitude preventing the US from achieving its green energy goals, warning that we need about 10,000 new clean energy projects to be built in the US this decade if we're to reach net zero by 2050. Learn more about what's needed to fight NIMBYism, get serious about the energy transition — and get out of our own way. https://www.ted.com/talks/rich_powell_enough_red_tape_we_need_to_say_yes_to_clean_energy?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122192 122192 Fri, 05 Jan 2024 15:59:25 +0000高等教育不00:11:35泰德
不要对你的咖啡师做混蛋——以及对一线工作的其他想法|阿德里安·内格雷罗斯阿德里安·内格雷罗斯All jobs, especially those held by frontline workers, should have dignity and the ability to turn into great careers, says change management expert Adriann Negreros. From shift flexibility to ending work on time, he outlines what he calls the "handbook of humanity" — people-centered ideas for change, rooted in empathy — that, when implemented, can redefine the nature of frontline work.不要对你的咖啡师做混蛋——以及对一线工作的其他想法|阿德里安·内格雷罗斯All jobs, especially those held by frontline workers, should have dignity and the ability to turn into great careers, says change management expert Adriann Negreros. From shift flexibility to ending work on time, he outlines what he calls the "handbook of humanity" — people-centered ideas for change, rooted in empathy — that, when implemented, can redefine the nature of frontline work. https://www.ted.com/talks/adriann_negreros_don_t_be_a_jerk_to_your_barista_and_other_thoughts_on_frontline_work?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122878 122878 Fri, 05 Jan 2024 15:54:34 +0000高等教育不00:12:41泰德
你冲进马桶的重要数据|纽莎·加利纽莎·加利"Everybody pees and poops — and we know that urine and stool contain a rich source of information on our health," says data detective Newsha Ghaeli. Exploring the growing field of wastewater epidemiology, she shows how studying sewage can (anonymously) reveal a lot about the collective well-being of our cities — leading to real-time quality-of-life improvements like tracking pandemics, updating social policies and much more.你冲进马桶的重要数据|纽莎·加利"Everybody pees and poops — and we know that urine and stool contain a rich source of information on our health," says data detective Newsha Ghaeli. Exploring the growing field of wastewater epidemiology, she shows how studying sewage can (anonymously) reveal a lot about the collective well-being of our cities — leading to real-time quality-of-life improvements like tracking pandemics, updating social policies and much more. https://www.ted.com/talks/newsha_ghaeli_the_vital_data_you_flush_down_the_toilet?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:123146 123146 Thu, 04 Jan 2024 15:51:31 +0000高等教育不00:09:33泰德
你的领导语言是什么？ |罗西塔·纳吉米罗西塔·纳吉米In a globe-trotting career that has spanned corporations, governments, nonprofits and philanthropy, Rosita Najmi has often found herself translating among them. Instead of focusing on leadership style, she makes the case for becoming fluent in the languages of leadership, explaining how it can help you adapt to audiences across industries and collectively achieve your goals.你的领导语言是什么？ |罗西塔·纳吉米In a globe-trotting career that has spanned corporations, governments, nonprofits and philanthropy, Rosita Najmi has often found herself translating among them. Instead of focusing on leadership style, she makes the case for becoming fluent in the languages of leadership, explaining how it can help you adapt to audiences across industries and collectively achieve your goals. https://www.ted.com/talks/rosita_najmi_what_s_your_leadership_language?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122058 122058 Wed, 03 Jan 2024 15:57:58 +0000高等教育不00:08:12泰德
生活艰难。艺术有帮助|利亚娜·芬克利亚娜·芬克Cartoonist Liana Finck's drawings hold our hands through life's predicaments, big and small: dating, breakups, what to make for dinner, how to leave a party without being rude, how to think about our relationship with God. In a funny, moving talk, she shares some of her drawings and shows how she uses creativity to navigate false starts and cluelessness in the search for belonging.生活艰难。艺术有帮助|利亚娜·芬克Cartoonist Liana Finck's drawings hold our hands through life's predicaments, big and small: dating, breakups, what to make for dinner, how to leave a party without being rude, how to think about our relationship with God. In a funny, moving talk, she shares some of her drawings and shows how she uses creativity to navigate false starts and cluelessness in the search for belonging. https://www.ted.com/talks/liana_finck_life_is_hard_art_helps?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118065 118065 Tue, 02 Jan 2024 15:56:10 +0000高等教育不00:07:33泰德
为什么企业需要梦想家的魔力和实干家的现实主义？贝丝·维纳贝丝·维纳At work, the dreamers often get credit for the big ideas, but they can also sometimes seem untethered to reality to the doers, who are trying to ... get things done. It's when these two types of humans work in harmony that business magic happens, says culture strategist Beth Viner. She lays out a practical blueprint for harnessing the dreamer's out-of-the-box thinking and the doer's practicality, showing why it's the key to building, growing and innovating in any relationship or organization.为什么企业需要梦想家的魔力和实干家的现实主义？贝丝·维纳At work, the dreamers often get credit for the big ideas, but they can also sometimes seem untethered to reality to the doers, who are trying to ... get things done. It's when these two types of humans work in harmony that business magic happens, says culture strategist Beth Viner. She lays out a practical blueprint for harnessing the dreamer's out-of-the-box thinking and the doer's practicality, showing why it's the key to building, growing and innovating in any relationship or organization. https://www.ted.com/talks/beth_viner_why_businesses_need_a_dreamer_s_magic_and_a_doer_s_realism?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122223 122223 Thu, 21 Dec 2023 15:44:32 +0000高等教育不00:11:06泰德
当人工智能可以伪造现实时，你还能信任谁？ |萨姆·格雷戈里萨姆·格雷戈里We're fast approaching a world where widespread, hyper-realistic deepfakes lead us to dismiss reality, says technologist and human rights advocate Sam Gregory. What happens to democracy when we can't trust what we see? Learn three key steps to protecting our ability to distinguish human from synthetic — and why fortifying our perception of truth is crucial to our AI-infused future.当人工智能可以伪造现实时，你还能信任谁？ |萨姆·格雷戈里We're fast approaching a world where widespread, hyper-realistic deepfakes lead us to dismiss reality, says technologist and human rights advocate Sam Gregory. What happens to democracy when we can't trust what we see? Learn three key steps to protecting our ability to distinguish human from synthetic — and why fortifying our perception of truth is crucial to our AI-infused future. https://www.ted.com/talks/sam_gregory_when_ai_can_fake_reality_who_can_you_trust?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122245 122245 Wed, 20 Dec 2023 15:59:12 +0000高等教育不00:12:01泰德
我的使命是改变心理健康的叙述|格伦·克洛斯格伦·克洛斯Legendary actor and mental health advocate Glenn Close is on a quest to change how we think about mental health, starting with her decision to speak out about her own family's struggles — a brave choice considering the stigma that pervades the topic. In a sweeping conversation with TEDWomen curator Pat Mitchell, Close shares the inspiration behind the advocacy group she founded to combat the crisis, underscoring the transformative power of community and the critical need for comprehensive mental health care systems.我的使命是改变心理健康的叙述|格伦·克洛斯Legendary actor and mental health advocate Glenn Close is on a quest to change how we think about mental health, starting with her decision to speak out about her own family's struggles — a brave choice considering the stigma that pervades the topic. In a sweeping conversation with TEDWomen curator Pat Mitchell, Close shares the inspiration behind the advocacy group she founded to combat the crisis, underscoring the transformative power of community and the critical need for comprehensive mental health care systems. https://www.ted.com/talks/glenn_close_my_mission_to_change_the_narrative_of_mental_health?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122057 122057 Tue, 19 Dec 2023 15:45:48 +0000高等教育不00:12:08泰德
为什么你应该拥抱平庸 |克里斯平·瑟洛克里斯平·瑟洛From "elite" pickles to "premium" baby diapers, marketers are constantly telling us to seek superiority — but "by the simple law of averages, most of us have to live a life more ordinary," says sociolinguist Crispin Thurlow. He invites us to embrace mediocrity for a change, offering a different path to contentedness without comparison.为什么你应该拥抱平庸 |克里斯平·瑟洛From "elite" pickles to "premium" baby diapers, marketers are constantly telling us to seek superiority — but "by the simple law of averages, most of us have to live a life more ordinary," says sociolinguist Crispin Thurlow. He invites us to embrace mediocrity for a change, offering a different path to contentedness without comparison. https://www.ted.com/talks/crispin_thurlow_why_you_should_embrace_mediocrity?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:121937 121937 Mon, 18 Dec 2023 15:57:14 +0000高等教育不00:10:37泰德
为什么人工智能将引发指数级经济增长 |凯西·伍德凯西·伍德Investor Cathie Wood explores this unique moment in technology, which she sees as being marked by the simultaneous evolution of five pivotal innovation platforms — a scenario unparalleled in history. Exploring the role of AI in reshaping economic paradigms, she predicts a surge in global GDP growth and productivity, underscoring the need for businesses and investors to adapt in order to keep up.为什么人工智能将引发指数级经济增长 |凯西·伍德Investor Cathie Wood explores this unique moment in technology, which she sees as being marked by the simultaneous evolution of five pivotal innovation platforms — a scenario unparalleled in history. Exploring the role of AI in reshaping economic paradigms, she predicts a surge in global GDP growth and productivity, underscoring the need for businesses and investors to adapt in order to keep up. https://www.ted.com/talks/cathie_wood_why_ai_will_spark_exponential_economic_growth?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:121069 121069 Fri, 15 Dec 2023 19:49:23 +0000高等教育不00:14:37泰德
